alert.note: Alert for Union; Wayne (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:33AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WAYNE AND NORTHERN UNION COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, PREBLE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO, NORTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO, SOUTHWESTERN DARKE AND SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 615 AM EDT... At 533 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Fountain City, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Eaton, Centerville, Cambridge City, Camden, Lewisburg, Hagerstown, New Paris, West Alexandria, Gratis, Fountain City, Abington, Eldorado, West Manchester, Greens Fork, East Germantown, College Corner, Spring Grove, Bethel and Somerville. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
